item.title: Imperfect add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "I think we ought to read only the kind of books that wound or stab us. If the book we're reading doesn't wake us up with a blow to the head, what are we reading for? So that it will make us happy, as you write? Good Lord, we would be happy precisely if we had no books, and the kind of books that make us happy are the kind we could write ourselves if we had to. But we need books that affect us like a disaster, that grieve us deeply, like the death of someone we loved more than ourselves, like being banished into forests far from everyone, like a suicide. A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us. That is my belief." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Imperfect add a quote by Mother Theresa of Calcutta
item.description: "The so-called right to abortion has pitted mothers against their children and women against men. It has sown violence and discord at the heart of the most intimate human relationships. It has aggravated the derogation of the father's role in an increasingly fatherless society. It has portrayed the greatest of gifts--a child--as a competitor, an intrusion and an inconvenience. It has nominally accorded mothers unfettered dominion over the dependent lives of their physically dependent sons and daughters. And, in granting this unconscionable power, it has exposed many women to unjust and selfish demands from their husbands or other sexual partners." -- Mother Theresa of Calcutta

item.title: Imperfect add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "You are free and that is why you are lost." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Imperfect add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Most of the evil in this world is done by people with good intentions." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Imperfect add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "What is hell? Hell is oneself. Hell is alone, the other figures in it Merely projections. There is nothing to escape from And nothing to escape to. One is always alone." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Imperfect add a quote by Samuel Johnson
item.description: "He who makes a beast of himself gets rid of the pain of being a man." -- Samuel Johnson

item.title: Imperfect add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "I feel the greatest destroyer of peace today is 'Abortion', because it is a war against the child... A direct killing of the innocent child, 'Murder' by the mother herself... And if we can accept that a mother can kill even her own child, how can we tell other people not to kill one another? How do we persuade a woman not to have an abortion? As always, we must persuade her with love... And we remind ourselves that love means to be willing to give until it hurts..." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Imperfect add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "Whatever you think, be sure it is what you think; whatever you want, be sure that is what you want; whatever you feel, be sure that is what you feel." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: Imperfect add a quote by Simone Weil
item.description: "Imaginary evil is romantic and varied; real evil is gloomy, monotonous, barren, boring. Imaginary good is boring; real good is always new, marvelous, intoxicating." -- Simone Weil
